alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Limestone, northeastern Lauderdale, Moore, Lincoln and northwestern Franklin Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 737 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Loretto to 9 miles north of Manchester. Movement of the line was to the southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Estill Springs, Lexington, Petersburg, Tims Ford Lake, Anderson, Lester, Good Springs and Howell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Alabama...and Middle Tennessee.
